description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to allow changes to the design including introduction and repositions of louvres and the introduction of intake and extraction louvres and floor mounted condenser units,in pursuant to planning permission reference 202673OPDFUL dated 22/09/2020 for'' Change of use from industrial (Sui Generis) to studio, production and office accommodation (Sui Generis); installation of a security kiosk and a 2.4m high palisade boundary fence incorporating automatic electrically operated pedestrian and vehicle gates; enlarged doorways and new fire exits to existing elevations''
decision_conditions: DELETED | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) - SI-ZZ-DR-A-0800 Site Location Plan, SI-ZZ-DR-A-0810 Proposed Site Plan, B1-00-DR-A-0810 Existing Ground Floor Plan, B1-01-DR-A-0820 Existing First Floor Plan, B1-02-DR-A-0830 Existing Second Floor Plan, B1-ZZ-DR-A-9010 Existing North & South Elevations, B1-ZZ-DR-A-9020 Rev. E Existing East & West Elevations, B1-00-DR-A-2010 Proposed Ground Floor Plan, B1-01-DR-A-2011 Proposed First Floor Plan, B1-0-2-DR-A-2012 Proposed Second Floor Plan, B1-ZZDR-A-9050 Rev. F Proposed North & South Elevations, B1-ZZ-DR-A-9060 Rev. F Proposed East & West Elevations, BE-00-DR-A-2050 Security Kiosk, SI-00-DR-A-2060 Proposed Fence and Gates, Acton Studios Design & Access Statement Produced by Jenkins Design Services dated June 2020.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Prior to the commencement of the development, six secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the site and retained for the life of the development.

REASON: To ensure that adequate facilities for cyclists are provided in accordancemwith policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG. | The travel plan approved under consent 204428OPDCND dated 11.11.2020 shall be implemented in full prior to the occupation of development.

REASON: To promote the use of sustainable modes of transport and minimise traffic and parking congestion in accordance with Policy T4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Ealing SPD - Sustainable Transport for New Development. | The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from internal uses and activities is contained within the building, as assessed according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises incl. private external amenity spaces. Measures shall be implemented prior to use of the
development and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2023), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing SPG10. | Prior to use of the premises, external doors to rooms where amplified noise may be emitted shall be fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time during emission of noise shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10. | External rating noise level emiited from level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate in the development shall be as per approved condition 8 of planning ref.202673OPDFUL, approved condition ref. 214879OPDCND.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/equipment, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10. | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/equipment, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10.
